An Ibis
reviews.text: Nice rooms with same style furniture (compared to other hotels of the same brand) breakfast is plentiful with a great variety of cold cuts. WiFi is fast with no connecting problems. Staff was friendly, location is 5 minutes walk northern from the rail station.

On return journey from interlaken with friends we decided to spend one night in Ibis before catching the flight in the morning. Horrible mattresses which keep shifting with every turn you take while sleeping. I almost feel off the bed in the morning. They have a shower room (instead of the usual bath tub) which is nice but despite being properly closed the water was leaking while taking shower. So much so that the entire bathroom floor was wet.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: Lots of english channels on the TV which is again nice. The breakfast selection was okay but the server was discourteous. First she insisted that we should pay for breakfast (which we had already done at the time of booking coupled with advance payment at the time of check-in). When we stated that we have indeed paid she disappeared and reappeared again in the middle of our breakfast and dragged us down to the reception. When reception clarified that we have infact paid at which point she was sort of disappointed and did not even have the courtesy to apologise properly. All in all I left with a feeling that you get what you pay for. At 154 CHF (breakfast included) per night it has some nice touches (like air-conditioning in the room) but can improve a lot.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at the Ibis Geneve

reviews.text: P.S. - As I always say the hospitality and service should be learned from South East Asia and it should be mandatory for the servers to get trained in Asia.

reviews.text: I stayed there with a friend of mine for a couple of nights. Although the hotel is not exactly in the city centre, it is within walking distance to the main train station. It is a fairly quiet location, however, it does sit next to a busy road and if your room faces that direction, you might not want to keep the windows open at night.
reviews.title: Business Trip To Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've always been reluctant to stay in an Ibis hotel as they are often nit the best or are too near the train station. This hotel has changed my opinion completely. For £100 per night for two people including breakfast we got what appeared to be a brand new room. The hotel lobby was nicer than many other hotels I have stayed in. The room was smallish but did the trick for the night. There is a number 8 bus stop right outside and travel is free for hotel guests in Geneva. Even the breakfast was good with amazing coffee. The staff were also very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that it was over 30 degrees outside so the air cooler not aircon didn't keep things as cool as I would have liked. The website states aircon in each room but its an air cooling system. Otherwise, a great stay.
reviews.title: Never knew Ibis could be this nice

reviews.text: Very nice clean hotel. Close to the 8 bus and the 5 bus (from the airport). A nice little grocery store called Denner right across the street that had the best prices or water and groceries, but it's hours were rather limited. There is free wifi but you must ask for a code when you arrive. They also give you the free transport card that you can use on all public transport. Staff spoke English and were very helpful. Our room for 3 wasn't huge but it was sufficient.
reviews.title: Nice choice

reviews.text: Stayed two nights and couldn't complain about anything. Simple and clean amenities. Service was great all very friendly. Restaurant menu is very basic but there's a restaurant a few metres away which serves great pizzas.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: Stay in this recently-open (March 2013) hotel in mid July because of a conference in ITU.
reviews.title: It's Reasonably Good

reviews.text: You've gone for an Ibis, so you're not expecting a safe, fridge or shoe horn. Which is as well, as none are present. The good news is that this hotel has been recently transformed, and the new, clean feel translates to well-thought-out bedrooms (no of course there's no carpet, but the wood floors are clean) with large-screen TV, black-out curtains that work, and clean bathrooms with good showers. The beds are as comfortable as everyone says they are - a real plus. The breakfast is plentiful and of good quality; reception staff are courteous and efficient. The location is great for UN meetings - Nations is within walking distance - less brilliant for the lake/shopping/non-UN tourist places, but the great free transport system for travellers to Geneva means that this really isn't a problem.
reviews.title: A superior hotel of its type: frill-free but clean, and breakfast is great!
